monsters.name: Sasquatch
monsters.description: In American folklore, Bigfoot (also known as Sasquatch) is a simian-like creature that is said to inhabit forests, mainly in the Pacific Northwest. Bigfoot is usually described as a large, hairy, bipedal humanoid. The term sasquatch is an Anglicized derivative of the Halkomelem word sásq'ets.

monsters.name: Kraken
monsters.description: The Kraken is a legendary sea monster of giant size that is said to dwell off the coasts of Norway and Greenland. A number of authors over the years have postulated that the legend originated from sightings of giant squids that may grow to 12–15 meters (40–50 feet) in length, despite the fact that the creature in the original tales was not described as having tentacles and more closely resembled a whale or crab. The sheer size and fearsome appearance attributed to the kraken have made it a common ocean-dwelling monster in various fictional works.
monsters.attack: pulling ships into the briney depths

monsters.name: Mister Boogedy
monsters.description: The ghost of an ancient pilgrim, with a magic cloak

monsters.name: Chupacabra
monsters.description: The chupacabra or chupacabras, literally 'goat-sucker'; from 'chupar', 'to suck', and 'cabra', 'goat') is a legendary creature in the folklore of parts of the Americas, with its first purported sightings reported in Puerto Rico. The name comes from the animal's reported habit of attacking and drinking the blood of livestock, especially goats. Physical descriptions of the creature vary. It is purportedly a heavy creature, the size of a small bear, with a row of spines reaching from the neck to the base of the tail.
monsters.attack: tears sheep to pieces with it's razor teeth

monsters.name: Nosferatu
monsters.description: An undead, centuries-old vampire, and a Transylvanian nobleman who claims to be a Székely descended from Attila the Hun. He inhabits a decaying castle in the Carpathian Mountains near the Borgo Pass.
monsters.attack: tears sheep to pieces with it's razor teeth

monsters.description: The chupacabra or chupacabras, literally 'goat-sucker'; from 'chupar', 'to suck', and 'cabra', 'goat') is a legendary creature in the folklore of parts of the Americas, with its first purported sightings reported in Puerto Rico. The name comes from the animal's reported habit of attacking and drinking the blood of livestock, especially goats. Physical descriptions of the creature vary. It is purportedly a heavy creature, the size of a small bear, with a row of spines reaching from the neck to the base of the tail.
